artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Publisher: Tsunajima Kamekichi; Carver: Wada Yūjirō
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 503.3; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), fig. 279, p. 276.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: woman getting a tattoo on her PL arm; woman is leaning toward left, with her PR knee drawn up, looking over her PR shoulder, holding a blue and white cloth with flower pattern between her teeth, with a hand pricking her upper left arm, and another hand holding her forearm down; woman wears a purple-grey kimono with multicolored floral patterns, with a blue and white collar with star shapes and red undergarment
markings: Artist’s seal: たいそ{Taiso} | Carver’s seal: 和田彫勇 {Wada hori Yū}
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Thirty-two Aspects of Behaviors (Fūzoku sanjūnisō 風俗三十二相)
text: No. 3 on the table of contents
title: Appearing in Pain, Behavior of a Prostitute of the Kansei Era
